title: New certificate upon reverter of land
context: §501-167 New certificate upon reverter of land. When for any reason, by operation of law, land which was taken for a public use reverts to the owner from whom it was taken or to the owner&rsquo;s heirs or assigns, the court, upon the petition of the person entitled to the benefit of reversion, after notice and hearing, may order the entry of a new certificate of title to the person. [L 1903, c 56, §91; RL 1925, §3280; RL 1935, §5088; RL 1945, §12688; RL 1955, §342-88; HRS §501-167; gen ch 1985] Rules of Court New certificate of title, see RLC rule 59(m).
